headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; On the Care of Consumption, &c., by Medicated Inhalation. CASES. Case IX

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: SIR: As the treatment of diseases of the Lungs by lahalation from its very great success, is attracting the earnest attention of the public and the profession throughout the United States, a few explanations with reference to what is meant by Inhalation and the method of its employment in Pulmonary Diseases, seems urgently to be called for.

byline.original: ROBERT HUNTER, M. D.Mrs. E. KEELERJ.S. POLLARD

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE.; Discovery of the Remains of Sir John Franklin and his Unfortunte Coinpanions, From Havana and Key West. The Baltic's Advices at New-Orleans--Markets, &c. Mortality and Health of New-Orleanns. From Mexico. Destructive Fire in Baltimore. The Yellow Fever. Woman's Rights Convention. Marine Disaster. The New-England Horse Show. Steamer Osprey. The Outrage at Ellsworth. Attempt to Murder by Burglars. Sailing of the Steamer Charity and Departure of more Troops Burglary at Rochester. Robbery of Adams & Co.'s Express. The Run on Private Bunkers In Cincinnati. Forger Sentenced.

docs.lead_paragraph: A dispatch from Dr. RAE, dated at " York Factory, August 4, 1854," has been received by Sir GEORGE SIMSON, Governor of the Hudson Bay Territory, narrating the discovery of the remains of Sir JOHN FRANKLIN and his unfortunate companions who, it appears, were starved to death, in the Spring of 1850, to the northwest of Box River, The foregoing intelligence is regarded here as wholly reliable.

byline.original: By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH OF THE CITY.--The last few warm days have had an unfavorable influence upon the health of the city, and there has been a marked increase of new cases since the change. It is however true, that generally they are of a very mild character, and yield readily to prompt. treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: " Good wine," says the proverb, "needs no bush." What does bad wine need? It is startling to think of the amount of deleterious staff which is sold as "wine" all through the country,--especially Champagne.
docs.snippet: " Good wine," says the proverb, "needs no bush." What does bad wine need? It is startling to think of the amount of deleterious staff which is sold as "wine" all through the country,--especially Champagne.

headline.main: THE ARCTIC.; PUBLIC MEETING AS YONKERS. PROPOSED TESTIMONIAL TO CAPP. LUCE.

headline.main: NEW-YORK MEDICAL COLLEGE.; HONORARY CERTIFICATES CONFERRED. Dr. Parker's Introductory Address.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large audience assembled last evening at the New-York Medical College, to hear the lecture by Prof. PARKER, the introductory to the annual course of instruction. The exercise were opened

headline.main: OPENING OF THE MEDICAL SCHOOLS.; Fellowships Demanded--The Late Dr, Swett. New-York University-Medical Department. DR. DRAPER'S INTRODUCTORY.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was a large gathering on Monday night at the University to listen to the Intro lactory Address by Professor DRAPER. The andience was not composed entirely of medical students--there was a handsome representation from the lady friends of the Institution, and a goodly number of City physicians.
